form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Nelson (for himself, Mr. Schumer, Mrs. Boxer, Mr. Blumenthal, Mrs. Feinstein, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Markey, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Murphy, and Mr. Whitehouse) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To modernize the Undetectable Firearms Act of 1988.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Undetectable Firearms Modernization Act of 2015.

section.header: Modernization of the prohibition on undetectable firearms
section.text: Section 922(p) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking grips, stocks, and magazines and inserting all parts other than a major component; and

in subparagraph (B), by striking when subjected to inspection by the types of x-ray machines commonly used at airports, does not generate and inserting the following: if subjected to inspection by the types of detection devices commonly used at airports for security screening, would not generate;
by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:
the term major component, with respect to a firearm—

clause.text: means the slide or cylinder or the frame or receiver of the firearm; and
in the case of a rifle or shotgun, includes the barrel of the firearm; and

subparagraph.text: by striking subparagraph (C) and all that follows through the end of the undesignated matter following subparagraph (C) and inserting the following:
the term Security Exemplar means an object, to be fabricated at the direction of the Attorney General, that is—

clause.text: constructed of 3.7 ounces of material type 17–4 PH stainless steel in a shape resembling a handgun; and
suitable for testing and calibrating metal detectors.

subparagraph.text: in the first sentence, by inserting , including a prototype, after of a firearm; and
by striking the second sentence; and

paragraph.text: in paragraph (5), by striking shall not apply to any firearm which and all that follows and inserting the following: “shall not apply to—

subparagraph.text: any firearm received by, in the possession of, or under the control of the United States; or
the manufacture, importation, possession, transfer, receipt, shipment, or delivery of a firearm by a licensed manufacturer or licensed importer pursuant to a contract with the United States.
